response: narrative=Brian Porter had a history of disappearing without notice, occasionally causing worry among his family. On this occasion, he was reported missing after a night out. Earlier, Brian was last seen near Lochies Road, Burntisland, where he had spent the afternoon skateboarding with his brother. Brian missed work with no contact, a concerning pattern of behavior not unnoticed by his grandmother. The young boy was traced by the police two days later at 7 Pitreavie Court, Dunfermline. Brian's absence had once again highlighted the unpredictable nature of his outings and the challenges his family faced in managing his sudden disappearances.

narrative=Brian Porter was last seen leaving a study group at Lochies Road, Burntisland, KY3 9JX. Known for running off previously, Brian had mentioned visiting his grandmother, but she hadn't seen him that day. His friend, Gary Kay, reported that Brian appeared distracted, talking about a nearby rehab center he had heard about. There were concerns that Brian might have headed towards 7 Dollar Grove, Burntisland, KY3 0JZ, where family connections were uncertain. Witnesses reported seeing a young boy fitting Brian’s description near a vehicle-related incident in that area. With the aid of a bystander who recognized him, Brian was safely located days later, appearing unharmed but disoriented.

narrative=Brian Porter went missing after a night out. He was last seen leaving a rehab center. After speaking to Lucy Smith, his whereabouts became clearer, and he was found near a vehicle at 3 Seals Craig View, Burntisland.

narrative=Brian Porter, a 13-year-old boy, was reported missing after last being seen at a skate park in North Queensferry. Known to have been experiencing an identity crisis, concerns were raised by friend Gary Kay when Brian failed to return home. It's believed Brian took his bicycle from the skate park, possibly en route to visit Kathryn Wallis, a close friend residing in the area. Brian has shown interest in rehab centers, having discussed them with his grandfather previously. Days later, while a search was underway including an investigation of vehicle-related areas, he was found by police being reunited with a friend near a sports club on Castlandhill Road, Rosyth, safe and unharmed.

narrative=Brian Porter was last seen leaving his home at 43 The Temple, Lower Largo. His mother reported that he had ongoing concerns over addiction, potentially from influences outside of the home, and was scheduled to attend regular sessions at a rehab center. Before his disappearance, Brian experienced an identity crisis, struggling to understand his place within his peer group. His brother mentioned that Brian had expressed a desire to visit areas such as Rosyth for music lessons, which he found therapeutic. After being traced by a member of the public, Brian was found at a location not far from 97 Backmarch Road, Rosyth, indicating he might have been seeking solace or companionship in that vicinity.
